intro: Heteropterys molesta, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Heteropterys molesta is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in certain regions.
